questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks has recently rolled out Lightning Experience and uses an ERP system as its system of record for customers. When a new Account has its first closed/won opportunity, the ERP system should immediately update with information from the account, contact, and opportunity records related to the Account to record a new customer.

Which option should the consultant recommend to meet the requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
it should be C

choices.C: Implement Platform Events to publish opportunity wins to the ERP, which will call back for account, contact, and opportunity information and automatically update the ERP accordingly.
choices.B: Configure Outbound message to publish the opportunity wins and update the ERP with opportunity, account, and contact information from Salesforce.
choices.A: Identify AppExchange products that can be deployed to update the ERP with opportunity, account, and contact information from Salesforce.
choices.D: Use enterprise ETL tools to extract closed/won opportunities from Salesforce and update the ERP with opportunity, account, and contact information from Salesforce.

questions.question_text:
Up to this point, two sales reps have had separate accounts and opportunities. Sales Rep A wants to include Sales Rep B in a few opportunities on one account.

Which two actions can Sales Rep A allow Sales Rep B to do when Account Teams are enabled and used for this account? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
BC
you can give access to view only one specific opportunity on an account in Salesforce by using manual sharing to grant read-only access to that single opportunity for a user, even if they wouldn't normally have access to it based on their profile and role hierarchy settings; this allows you to control access to individual records on a case-by-case basis

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
it is BC
Correct answers are A and B

choices.B: View one of the opportunities on the account.
choices.D: Edit all opportunities on the account.
choices.A: Grant Read access on the accounts cases.
choices.C: View the account and keep activities private.
Enable schedules on the Orders object.
choices.D: Enable schedules on the Opportunity object.
choices.A: Enable schedules on the Product object.
choices.B: Enable schedules on the Contract object.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Enable schedules on the Product object:

Product Schedules: Salesforce allows you to track payment schedules and product delivery schedules by enabling Product Schedules on the Product object.

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks (CK) sells online subscriptions for its leading Shoe of the Month club. Customers can make a single payment or pay weekly, monthly, or quarterly. CK wants to use Opportunities to track and report on these subscription deals.

What should a consultant recommend to meet this requirement?

choices.A: Create a custom field on the Lead and Account objects and configure mapping of these two fields for conversion. Create a custom formula field on the Account object to pull the value from the Contact object.
choices.D: Create a custom field on the Lead and Account objects and configure mapping of these two fields for conversion. Create a custom formula field on the Contact object to pull the value from the Account object.
choices.C: Create a custom field on the Lead, Account, and Contact objects and configure mapping of these two fields for conversion. Use a trigger to update the Contact field with the Account value.
choices.B: Create a custom field on the Lead and Account objects. Create a custom formula field on the Contact object to pull the value from the Account object.
